timeline.message: Add logic to authenticate with Azure Arc MI

timeline.author: jianghaolu
g2vinay

timeline.bodyText: should clientId and environment be private since they have getters?
timeline.author: jianghaolu

timeline.bodyText: Environment variable IMDS_ENDPOINT is never used in ArcIdentityCredential, is that normal?
timeline.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText: If so - what's the value for?
replies.author: jianghaolu

replies.bodyText:
Currently, its just used to determine the Arc Env.
After discussing with @catalinaperalta , she mentioned we won't try auth with their IMDS endpoint.
We use the IDENTITY_ENDPOINT for auth req.
replies.author: g2vinay

replies.bodyText: This is correct we only use IMDS_ENDPOINT as a signal to indicate that were on an Arc host.
replies.author: schaabs

timeline.bodyText: If managedIdentityServiceCredential is null, getToken() method throws an exception. So, why not throw that exception here itself? Why delay throwing exception until later? Since this is final it won't change after the constructor is called anyway.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
yeah, this is by design.
We don't throw exceptions beyond user input validation at build/construction level.
DefaultAzureCredential will start to break at the construction level too, which shouldn't happen and this will be a breaking change as well.
replies.author: g2vinay

timeline.bodyText: This can potentially throw NPE if managedIdentityServiceCredential is null. So, as mentioned above, it might be better to just throw an exception in ctor itself if it's null.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Where is this scanner used? s is overwritten on line 810 before it's used. Also, update the variable name to scanner to make it more readable.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: If the status is 410, do we expect to swallow the exception and continue?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
you mean 401,
yes we are expected to swallow it and read the response.
replies.author: g2vinay

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I meant 401. In that case, can we add a logger to indicate that we ignored this exception?
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Should the connection be closed here before throwing the exception?
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: openConnection() and connect() can throw exceptions too. We should wrap this in a try-finally block to clean up the connection in case of failures.
timeline.author: srnagar
